page.title: 12THE MEDIA IN S CREAKE
page.content: National and local newspapers, and a selection of periodicals, are delivered by hand to many houses in S Creake, having been brought by van from Kings Lynn. There is our own Creakes news-sheet, distributed free, four times a year, by volunteers. it contains articles, poems, drawings of local interest, written and drawn by residents of all ages; with a forthcoming events page, showing times and dates of all village activities. Schoolboys deliver two free advertising papers each week. Most homes have television and radios, and videos are becoming popular in the younger households. The mobile Public Library calls once a month.
